results.title: The Screen writer
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Pictures a typical screen writer and analyses his job. The writer, whether the script is adapted or original, is the starting point for a picture. During actual production the writer often advises actors and director on aspects of production. The film cites some writers who have directed or produced their own scripts and others who are not heads of production at major studios.

results.title: The Screen director
results.creator_credit: Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Follows a typical director through his work at a Hollywood studio. The director interprets the parts to actors and offers other suggestions to casting director, cameraman, art director, writer and producer. He approves every detail during production. He decides how the picture shall be edited and works with the musicians in scoring it. The film includes newsreel shots of directors receiving Academy Awards.

results.title: The Score [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Gary Foster, Lee Rich, CP Medien, Mandalay Pictures and MP Management
results.brief_description: Set in Montreal, “The Score” is a film that revolves around three generations of criminals (and actors) enmeshed in a potentially rewarding heist with a lot of attendant risks. Nick Wells is a criminal who knows to stick with the rules that make him successful: never work in the city where you live and never work with a partner. His mentor in crime Max, entices Nick to break both these rules and hook up with young blade Jack Teller, and rob Customs House in Montreal for a priceless sceptre. Nick is suspicious of Jack and distrusting of his ways. The three however must find a way to work together in order to collect the booty. Frank Oz (Bowfinger, In and Out, Dirty rotten scoundrels) directs this stylish thriller that is as much about the dynamics between the thieves as it is about a crime. Using a well-worn formula (one last job), “The Score” nevertheless manages to impress with its ability to build and sustain tension. Apparently a degree of improvisation was used in the scenes between De Niro and Brando, the latter of whom was less than co-operative in taking directions from Oz and preferred to be instructed by De Niro.

results.title: The Science of winning
results.brief_description: This film shows specialists at the Australian Institute of Sport in Canberra working elite athletes, applying the processes of physiology, biochemistry, biomechanics and psychology. This is a thought-provoking document about the development of our systematic scientific approach to sports training.

results.title: The Science of table tennis
results.brief_description: A coaching film demonstrating the basic movements and stokes in table tennis. Two coaches working with a group of young players show the grips and strokes and demonstrates training exercises in footwork, body movement and control of the ball. The various strokes of table tennis, footwork and other techniques, are demonstrated by international coach, Jack Carrington.

results.title: The Science of energy: the solar generation
results.brief_description: Depicts solar energy installations in the United States and other countries, including several types of solar homes, industrial applications, and laboratory development of the solar cell, suggesting future large-scale use of solar energy.

results.title: The Schools - as they appear to people who teach in them
results.brief_description: The education system of England and Wales. Teachers from all types of state and private schools talk as individuals about their work - its shortcomings, its frustration, it opportunities, it creative excitement, and its future. How education works in England and Wales is explained and a wide divergence of opinions is revealed as the what, in the end, is the best system, to meet today’s needs.

results.title: The Schoolmaster
results.brief_description: A portrait of a young schoolmaster who teachesz in a small country town in the Scottish hills. The film describes his home, his work, his relations with his pupils and their parents, and the affection and respect with which he is regarded. This film gives a intimate picture of the workings and atmosphere of a typical; school in Britain in a setting of traditional Scottish countryside.

results.title: The School of military engineering
results.brief_description: The instruction and training of engineers in the Australian Military Forces. Shows teaching facilities of the School of Military Engineering. Illustrates the jobs army engineers are required to do: the building of sewages disposal plants; demolition of bridges; the laying of land mines, also the detection and disposal of enemy mines.
